00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 PGmiscevaluators.pl - Some miscellaneous answer macros.
00020 
00021 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00022 
00023 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00024 
00025 Currently contains answer evaluators for radio buttons and checkboxes.
00026 
00027 =head2 MathObjects and answer evaluators
00028 
00029 The MathObjects system provides a parserRadioButtons.pl file that manages
00030 display and checking of radio-button based answers. It is recommended that you
00031 use this method directly if possible.
00032 
00033 =cut
00034 
00035 BEGIN { be_strict() }
00036 sub _PGmiscevaluators_init {}
00037 
00038 =head1 checkbox_cmp
00039 
00040     ANS(checkbox_cmp($correctAnswer))
00041 
00042 $correctAnswer is a string containing the names of the correct boxes, e.g.
00043 "ACD". Note that this means that individual checkbox names can only be one
00044 character. Internally, this is largely the same as unordered_cs_str_cmp().
00045 
00046 =cut
00047 
00048 # added 6/14/2000 by David Etlinger
00049 # because of the conversion of the answer
00050 # string to an array, I thought it better not
00051 # to force STR_CMP() to work with this
00052 
00053 #added 2/26/2003 by Mike Gage
00054 # handled the case where multiple answers are passed as an array reference
00055 # rather than as a \0 delimited string.
00056 sub checkbox_cmp {
00057     my  $correctAnswer = shift @_;
00058     my %options = @_;
00059     assign_option_aliases( \%options,
00060      );
00061     set_default_options(    \%options,
00062                 'debug'                 =>  0,
00063                 'type'                  =>  'checkbox_cmp',
00064     );
00065     my $answer_evaluator = new AnswerEvaluator(
00066         correct_ans      => $correctAnswer,
00067         type             => $options{type},
00068     );
00069     # pass along debug requests
00070     $answer_evaluator->{debug} = $options{debug};
00071     
00072     # join student answer array into a single string if necessary
00073     $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(sub {
00074         my $rh_ans = shift;
00075         $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'convert student_ans to string';
00076         $rh_ans->{student_ans} = join("", @{$rh_ans->{student_ans}}) 
00077                  if ref($rh_ans->{student_ans}) =~/ARRAY/i;
00078         $rh_ans;
00079     });
00080     # ignore order of check boxes
00081     $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(\&ignore_order);
00082     # compare as strings
00083     $answer_evaluator->install_evaluator(sub {
00084         my $rh_ans     = shift;
00085         $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'compare strings generated by checked boxes';
00086         $rh_ans->{score} = ($rh_ans->{student_ans} eq $rh_ans->{correct_ans}) ? 1 : 0;
00087         $rh_ans;
00088     });
00089     # fix up preview displays
00090     $answer_evaluator->install_post_filter( sub {
00091         my $rh_ans      = shift;
00092         $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'adjust preview strings';
00093         $rh_ans->{type} = $options{type};
00094         $rh_ans->{preview_text_string}  =   '\\text{'.$rh_ans->{student_ans}.'}',
00095         $rh_ans->{preview_latex_string} =   '\\text{'.$rh_ans->{student_ans}.'}',
00096         $rh_ans;
00097     
00098     
00099     });
00100     
00101     return $answer_evaluator;
00102 }
00103 
00104 =head1 radio_cmp
00105 
00106     ANS(radio_cmp($correctAnswer))
00107 
00108 $correctAnswer  is a string containing the name of the correct radio button,
00109 e.g. "Choice1". This is case sensitive and whitespace sensitive, so the correct
00110 answer must match the name of the radio button exactly.
00111 
00112 =cut
00113 
00114 #added 6/28/2000 by David Etlinger
00115 #exactly the same as strict_str_cmp,
00116 #but more intuitive to the user
00117 
00118 # check that answer is really a string and not an array
00119 # also use ordinary string compare
00120 sub radio_cmp {
00121     #strict_str_cmp( @_ );
00122     my $response = shift;  # there should be only one item.
00123     warn "Multiple choices -- this should not happen with radio buttons. Have
00124     you used checkboxes perhaps?" if ref($response); #triggered if an ARRAY is passed
00125     str_cmp($response);
00126 }
